text: Streetart on the way to London Bridge. They've climbed on to that roof to add that splash of colour. https://t.co/vdH3WRKJiH
Final look over my lecture on my drag PhD for tomorrow. I'm so, so tempted to take my feather boa along and make a whirl of it.
Marking a dissertation on Interior: Leather Bar. If @AntBit ever suggests a screening to you, snap his hand off!
@Cinemartyn Agreed. The further he goes, he makes me think of his Casanova's evil twin. So many similarities, but flipped.
@ThatNeilMartin Who the heck is this? I must steal them at the Christmas party!
@MoxieMcMurder check back through my timeline photos and there's loads of weird stuff in the area. The Shakespeare head is a standout.
@Jedshepherd Wicked! I need to get myself up earlier - there's also a darned good coffee stall if I can rouse m'self ;-)
@MoxieMcMurder yep, though the viaduct is like something out of a dystopian horror film - there is Skulltipede grafitti. It's amazing.
@Jedshepherd apparently they have quite a few swords early, but on Saturdays I don't surface that early. Not even for pointy shiny things.
@MoxieMcMurder thanks! It must be said it's actually very hard to take a bad photo of this place because it is so utterly fascinating.
@Jedshepherd Indeed! I got some amazing (& dirt cheap) Gurkha swords a few months ago. I need a rummage - specifically a wig for a thing.
Deptford the beautiful. #london #church #graveyard https://t.co/cGjYlLVSOn
Talking to my colleagues, all of whom are PhDs. Several are doing accents. I swear lecturers are frustrated actors (and not just me).

Doing my lecture on drag performance on Wednesday morning. This group swing their pants. Wondering what I can get away with...
Looking at my annual research/publications report, you'd never believe I also lecture on kids' film and TV studies... #Imnicereally
@RealCrimeMag I'll be humming the chorus to 'Respectable' for the rest of the day ;-)
Is now allowed to include my journalism in my academic annual report. @RealCrimeMag rocks the Ivory Tower! (I consider this a huge win!)
My review of #LostGirl for @SciFiNow. It's genuinely unsettling & caustically hilarious (Oleg's marvelous):  https://t.co/3ZAz2gbGBd

@ThatNeilMartin I must say that is a very snazzy coat.
@ThatNeilMartin Both awesome, but I'm intrigued as to why? (Not the suggestions I've had in the past)
@ThatNeilMartin I do a decent 11th... https://t.co/yucArMii6T
Now that is one amazing crucifix. That tour has my name on it.  https://t.co/yNYX9piTWF
On ebay buying Supervillain things lastnight (AKA bandanas). The RUL Christmas do won't need disco lights... apols to fashionistas in adv.
@ThatNeilMartin A tache plus mini denim shorts plus a pastel blue jacket? Dude, really! Get outta here! ;-)
@ThatNeilMartin You do know you only have to do the tache for Movember, right?
@natachakennedy Aside from issues of the Guardian's traditional political stance, are they still publishing pro-trans pieces?
@ghostlytom @mikerainham Plus his Purple Man is terrifying in places because he does do understated sections.
@ghostlytom @mikerainham But he is also capable of letting characters permeate him - I loved most of Casanova & parts of his Barty Crouch.
@ghostlytom @mikerainham Sometimes he/his directors do rely on his charisma rathern his acting (esp in Dr Who, I felt) (1/2) #DavidTennant
@JonathanHatfull wait til you get to episode five, I think. It's so simple but it had me giggling for the next half hour.
David Tennant's Kilgrave in #JessicaJones is basically 2 parts his Casanova, 1 part his Dr Who. But evil. I absolutely love it!
@JonathanHatfull (Despite my best intentions, I've been glued for the last 7 hours...)
@JonathanHatfull If you're not already doing, see Jessica Jones for the best superhero name ever. I'm still chuckling....
.@ThatNeilMartin chatting up Hubert. This bodes ill for humanity... https://t.co/k1elAMiaKf
On episode 5 of Jessica Jones and I feel like I'm being shamed by 'Rambo'. Back in the gym tomorrow (bodyweight in chocolate now...).
@ThatNeilMartin Dear lord, get off QVC, man! You're making next time far too easy for me.
David Tennant, I love you! Hook, line and sinker for #JessicaJones https://t.co/YE7D6DYiq3
Jessica Jones... I could drown in those eyes...
Realised I was dressed as a Supervillain at work. Informed I can pull it off. Need to grow twirly tache now.. https://t.co/YfGb1Yk0lD
Yesterday I found the sparkly dickie bow I thought I'd lost 3 years ago. I have however lost my tiepins. Christmas party sartorial argh etc.
My students being introduced to @prof_elemental yesterday. I suspect they'll be busting these moves in Mahiki. https://t.co/ZnaveOIL2j
At a Work party. Just been introd to a guy who did my ghost tour, saw my cabaret show & we've just been talking Ripper Museum. Small world.
Teach a class of international students Adam Ant's "Prince Charming" dance: achievement unlocked. Restrained myself from taking photos...
@TheCrowLady I recommend Fighting Trousers, I'm British, Straight Out of Surrey and Songs for Acids Ed for your Friday constitutional.
@TheCrowLady Up Mr B!  I'm wearing a very handsome cravat in your honour, m'dear! Well, dressed up as Prince Charming for class, but heyho.
@ThatNeilMartin @PhreniX Neilster, you do realise we've got to upstage that this year? It is fancy dress, you know...
@ThatNeilMartin You must have it somewhere. Else it's under THE PILE. Please don't make me go through THE PILE.

@pauseforthejet @timeshighered I agree completely. This is a hugely important article.
This is vital - and terrifying - reading for everyone working in academia. It's like peer review but worse.  https://t.co/vc8PkS1Sri

Just finished reviewing a book that has had me howling my eyes out. It is imperfect, but I am also soppy.
Santa gets ready to cudgel Cupid, despite being in a Christian shop's window. https://t.co/oNOOj3E6xJ
Tutorial on nightclub studies. I suggested reading up on Area 51. I of course meant Studio 54. Student is still crying with laughter...
Tutorial with ladylike student on queer slash fiction in X-Men in an unused cinema filled with maintenance blokes. Their faces= priceless.

Trying to write ethical, intelligent clickbait is proving amusing....
Doing something on Dahmer vs Gacy. Yes, it's awful, but it actually hits its comedic marks surprisingly often. Aristotle'd be impressed.

Prepping scripts for Moviedrome for imminent filming.
Yesterday my 2 classes discussed terrorism & memory in media. They are from varied religions & none. I didn't need to chair. There is hope.

Watch the fun bits of Stand By Me & my students're silent. Watch a downbeat doc on Nazi war criminals with Alzheimer's, they're animated.
Age in media for today's lectures. One phrase: "Chopper: sick balls!" Prepare for shouting to resound across the land at the train scene.
The very peculiar feeling of thinking you are reviewing A book of old-style Victoriana and finding instead it is a novel based on rumpy...

#Allmymovies and the obvious, Adam Sandler.

@JLFilm Ambled over a porn cat installation thingy under a viaduct the other night. Scared the life out of ourselves. Then played with it.
@JLFilm It's weird. There's plenty that can get you in trouble (in the right ways), but it takes a bit of prodding to find it ;-)
@JLFilm I'm based in one of the supposedly dicey https://t.co/Ifr5373P7v areas & have no worries doing dark alleys at night.

@JLFilm I think the danger's still there, it's just changed. And has to be found.
